data.chText: 参与；作为一部分；有关联
data.enText: taking part in sth; being part of sth or connected with sth

data.chText: 我们首先应该仔细考虑与这一项目有关的所有费用。
data.enText: We need to examine all the costs involved in the project first.

data.chText: 我们将作出决定，再与有关人员联系。
data.enText: We'll make our decision and contact the people involved.

data.chText: 有人设法阻止打斗，但我不想牵涉进去。
data.enText: Some people tried to stop the fight but I didn't want to get involved.

data.text: In this meaning, involved is often used after a noun.
involved作此义时常用于名词之后。

data.enText: giving a lot of time or attention to sb/sth

data.chText: 她曾全心投入当地医院。
data.enText: She was deeply involved with the local hospital.

data.chText: 我全神贯注在看书，没听到你敲门。
data.enText: I was so involved in my book I didn't hear you knock.
He's a very involved father (= he spends a lot of time with his children) .
having a close personal relationship with sb

data.chText: 你在这件事上投入太多感情了。
data.enText: You're too emotionally involved with the situation.

means: 使成为必然部分(或结果)

ex.zh: 参与的人们；投入的人们
参与（或投入到）某一过程中的
深深卷入的；全身心投入的；关系十分暧昧的
涉及（或投入）感情的；有感情关系的

tr: entangled or hindered as if e.g. in mire
example: the difficulties in which the question is involved
brilliant leadership mired in details and confusion

tr: connected by participation or association or use
example: we accomplished nothing, simply because of the large number of people involved
I don't want to get involved
everyone involved in the bribery case has been identified
the difficulties in which the question is involved

tr: highly complex or intricate and occasionally devious
example: Byzantine methods for holding on to his chairmanship
got his way by labyrinthine maneuvering
Oh, what a tangled web we weave"- Sir Walter Scot

value.def: If you are involved in a situation or activity, you are taking part in it or have a strong connection with it.

example.ex: If she were involved in business, she would make a strong chief executive...
example.tran: 如果她投身商业的话,她会是一个很有能力的总裁。

example.ex: She became involved with political causes after the Chernobyl nuclear disaster...
example.tran: 在切尔诺贝利核泄漏灾难发生以后,她开始投身政界。

example.ex: The Farmers' Club is an organisation for people involved in agriculture.
example.tran: 农场主俱乐部是为农业界人士创办的组织。

value.tran: 卷入的;参与的;与…有密切关联的

value.def: If you are involved in something, you give a lot of time, effort, or attention to it.

example.ex: The family were deeply involved in Jewish culture.
example.tran: 这家人非常注重学习犹太文化。

example.ex: ...women who are so involved in their careers that they have no time for friendship.
example.tran: 忙于事业以至于无暇顾及友谊的女性

value.def: The things involved in something such as a job or system are the necessary parts or consequences of it.

example.ex: We believe the time and hard work involved in completing such an assignment are worthwhile...
example.tran: 我们认为完成这项任务所必须付出的时间与辛苦都是值得的。

example.ex: He cannot reveal how much money is involved in the scheme...
example.tran: 他不能透露该计划投入了多少钱。

example.ex: Let's take a look at some of the figures involved.
example.tran: 让我们看一下涉及的一些数字。

value.def: If a situation or activity is involved, it has a lot of different parts or aspects, often making it difficult to understand, explain, or do.

example.ex: The operations can be quite involved, requiring many procedures.
example.tran: 手术可能非常复杂,需要对多处进行手术。

value.tran: 复杂难懂的;棘手的;难处理的

value.def: If one person is involved with another, especially someone they are not married to, they are having a sexual or romantic relationship.

example.ex: He became romantically involved with a married woman.
example.tran: 他与一位已婚妇女产生了恋情。

value.tran: 关系暧昧的;有情爱关系的
